In the bundled default configurations, set the TooManyHopsDecideRule to 
have a 'max-hops' (or 'maxHops') value of '0'. This means follow no 
navigational outlinks.

The crawl will still follow outlinks that seem necessary to render the 
page -- inline, embedded resources like IMGs, SCRIPTs, FRAMEs, etc. To 
stop the crawl from following such outlinks, you can remove the 
TransclusionDecideRule.

However, if the configuration doesn't already have a 
PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule, add one at the end before removing the 
TransclusionDecideRule. (The normal pre-fetching of DNS and robots info 
depends on either TransclusionDecideRule or PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule 
being present, and after the TooManyHops rule.)

- Gordon @ IA
